tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came to
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:01|1:2]].

tn.ref: They will be like dung on the ground
tn.text: The sons and daughters born in the land are compared to dung because they will not be buried after they die. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: For they will come to an end
tn.text: This is a mild way to say that they will die. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
The word "sword" refers to an enemy army. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I have gathered up my peace, covenant faithfulness, and acts of tender mercy
tn.text: Yahweh gather different ways he has blessed the people of Israel to mean he will not bless the people of Israel anymore. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
This refers to all kinds of people and uses size to refer to how important they are. Either great importance or small importance. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: nor will anyone mourn for them. No one will cut themselves or shave their heads for them
tn.text: These two statements have similar meanings. The second one strengthens the thought in the first. AT: "No one will mourn for them in any way." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: cut themselves or shave their heads for them
tn.text: These are customs the people used to show they were very sad. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: No one must share any food in mourning to comfort them because of the deaths ... none must give a comforting cup to his father or his mother
tn.text: These two sentences have a similar meaning. It was customary to take food or wine to people whose relative has died. Yahweh has removed all comfort from the people because of their sin. AT: "Do not comfort people when their relative dies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Yahweh of hosts, God of Israel
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:07:03|7:3]].
AT: "Listen" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you"
Here the word "your" is plural and refers to the people of Israel. AT: "in front of you" or "where you can see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
AT: "during your lifetime" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: voices of the groom and bride
tn.text: This refers to people celebrating at weddings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].

tn.ref: worshiped and bowed down to them
tn.text: The words "bowed down to" mean basically the same thing as "worshiped" and describes the posture that people used in worship. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
The word "see" here adds emphasis to what follows. AT: "Indeed"

tn.ref: the stubbornness of his wicked heart
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:11:06|11:8]].
"who does what I tell him to do"
"force you to leave this land"
AT: "all the time" or "continually" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
The word "see" here adds emphasis to what follows. AT: "Indeed"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].

tn.ref: when it will no longer be said
tn.text: AT: "when people will no longer say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:12:16|12:16]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
Yahweh compares the people who will take the Israelites into captivity to people who are skilled at trapping their prey. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: my eye is on all their ways
tn.text: AT: "I am watching everything they do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: they cannot be hidden from before me
tn.text: Here the word "they" may refer either to the people or to their actions. AT: "they cannot hide their ways from me" or "I see all that they do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Their iniquity cannot be concealed from before my eyes
tn.text: AT: "I see all their sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: their filling my inheritance with their disgusting idols
tn.text: This phrase describes the "iniquity and sin" that the people had committed.
This refers to the land of Israel.
Here Jeremiah begins speaking to Yahweh.

tn.ref: my stronghold and my refuge, my place of safety
tn.text: Jeremiah speaks of Yahweh as a place where enemies cannot attack him. He repeats the same idea three times. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
AT: "everywhere on earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here the word "deceit" refers to false gods. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: They are empty; there is no profit in them
tn.text: Here the words "They" and "them" refer to the false gods that the ancestors taught them to believe in. The two phrases mean basically the same thing, with the second explaining how they "are empty." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Do people make gods for themselves?
tn.text: Jeremiah asks this question to emphasize that people cannot make gods for themselves. AT: "People can not make gods for themselves." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Here Yahweh begins speaking. The word "see" adds emphasis to what follows. AT: "Therefore, indeed,"

tn.ref: I will cause them to know
tn.text: Here the word "them" refers to the people from the nations. Yahweh repeats this phrase for emphasis.

Here the word "hand" refers to power and authority. The two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize Yahweh's great power. AT: "my great power." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: they will know that Yahweh is my name
tn.text: Here the word "name" refers to Yahweh's entire person. AT: "they will know that I am Yahweh, the true God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
